alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 2:46PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Greenwood County through 315 PM CDT... At 246 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Severy, or 12 miles north of Howard, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Severy, Climax, Piedmont, Fall River Lake and Fall River State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
